sentences.en: After a few drinks, he always became boastful about his wartime activities.
sentences.cn: 喝了几杯酒后, 他总要吹嘘一番他的战争经历.

sentences.en: Everyone who owns a factory feels the pinch in wartime.
sentences.cn: 碰着打仗,办厂的人不开心呀!

sentences.en: His wartime exploits were later made into a film.
sentences.cn: 他在战争中的英勇行为后来被改编成一部电影。

sentences.en: In fact, this was a genuine little wartime romance.
sentences.cn: 事实上, 这是一段名副其实的战争年代的小小罗曼史.

sentences.en: It was wartime and food was scarce.
sentences.cn: 那时是战争时期,食物短缺.

sentences.en: National unity is essential in wartime.
sentences.cn: 战时举国团结一致十分重要.

sentences.en: Since the wartime population needed replenishment, pregnancies were a good sign.
sentences.cn: 最后一桩倒不失为好现象,战时人口正该补充.

sentences.en: Some wartime vessels are still in commission.
sentences.cn: 有些战时的军舰仍在服役.

sentences.en: The film is set in wartime England.
sentences.cn: 电影拍摄的是战时英格兰.

sentences.en: The government will commandeer ships only in wartime.
sentences.cn: 政府只在战争时期征用船只。

sentences.en: The wartime temporaries will be replaced by permanent homes.
sentences.cn: 那些战时临时住房将被永久性住宅代替.

sentences.en: There the system of wartime price controls was challenged on delegation grounds.
sentences.cn: 在该案中,战争时期的价格控制以授权为由受到质疑.

sentences.en: There was very little snobbery or class-consciousness in the wartime navy.
sentences.cn: 战时的海军中很少有势利眼，阶级意识也不强。

sentences.en: Wartime austerities included food rationing and shortage of fuel.
sentences.cn: 战时的艰苦包括食物配给和燃料短缺.

sentences.en: We were all in our wartime infancy.
sentences.cn: 我们大家都处于战争的初期阶段.

trans.tran_en: the period of time when a country is fighting a war
